# Depot Operative (IBA)
 
⚲   Wellingborough
 
>
 
## Join a Team That Delivers Excellence Every Day
 
We’re looking for a reliable, hands-on person to join our busy material processing depot in Wellingborough. If you enjoy practical work, being part of a team, and want to work for a company that values its people, this could be the job for you.
 
Day Group is a family-owned business with over 75 years in construction and recycling. We’re known for our personal approach, dependability, and innovative solutions. With 25+ locations and nearly 700 people, we offer stability and real opportunities to grow.
 
Our new Wellingborough facility is a £20 million investment in the Midlands. Here, we recycle Incinerator Bottom Ash (IBA) from energy recovery plants and turn it into Ecoblend®, a range of sustainable aggregates used in construction. By recycling waste that would otherwise go to landfill, we help protect natural resources and promote responsible construction.
 
As a Depot Operative, you’ll play a key role in keeping the site running smoothly. This is a hands-on role where you’ll work as part of a team in a busy environment.
 

### What You’ll Do
 
  • Sort metal and other materials by hand from a moving conveyor belt
  • Use tools and equipment to clean conveyors, screens, and other plant areas
  • Help with maintenance and repairs when needed
  • Keep the site safe and tidy at all times
  • Follow health, safety, and environmental rules
 

### Hours
 
  • 45 hours per week, Monday to Friday
  • 10:00 am – 8:00 pm, with one hour unpaid for lunch
 

### About You
 
  • Physically fit and happy to work in an active role
  • A positive, “can-do” attitude
  • Reliable and able to work well with others
 
This role is based on-site at Ogee Business Park in Wellingborough, Northamptonshire. You’ll need to live within a reasonable commuting distance, and because of the location, having your own transport is recommended.
 

### What We Offer
 
  • Competitive pay with overtime opportunities
  • 9% non-contributory pension
  • Discretionary summer and Christmas bonuses
  • 20 days holiday + Bank Holidays + your birthday off
  • Bike-to-work scheme and GymFlex
  • Death in Service benefit
  • Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
  • Career development and training opportunities
  • Free onsite parking
 

### Why Join Day Group?
 
  • A friendly team that values hard work
  • Opportunities to learn and develop
  • Job security with a well-established company
  • PPE and training provided
 
All applicants must be eligible to work in the UK. Day Group is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

  • Liaise with the Logistics team to ensure customer satisfaction and resolve issues quickly
  • Ensure plant and equipment is properly maintained to maximise availability and safe operation
  • Monitor site activities including handling loose aggregates and operating process equipment
  • Accurately complete and submit weekly production logs.
  • Carry out any other reasonable tasks to support the safe and efficient running of the site

  • Willingness to take ownership of tasks and set a positive example to others
  • Previous experience in a supervisory role within aggregates, construction, or a similar operational industry is desirable
